descriptionSet.description: Thirteen women of different ethnic / cultural / national origin reach out for bottles of Kaminia hair oil. The bottles and boxes are handed down from "two goddesses of beauty" who lie on a large white cloud. One of them holds up a tablet with the hair oil products. The scene almost reminds the viewer of Da Vinci's Creazione di Adamo. A remarkable feature is the detailed elaboration of the women's clothes, costume accessories, jewellery and phenotypical features. The advertisement is aiming at the universal applicability of the hair oil's qualities, thus the text, "used by all nationalities (...)".

inscription.text: Kaminia-Oil is a gift from the goddess of beauty.
Used by all nationalities for Preserving & Beautifying the Hair.

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Crowd of women, in a poster advertisement of Kaminia Oil

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: Kaminia-Oil is a gift from the goddess of beauty.
text-en: Used by all nationalities for Preserving & Beautifying the Hair.

description-en: Thirteen women of different ethnic / cultural / national origin reach out for bottles of Kaminia hair oil. The bottles and boxes are handed down from "two goddesses of beauty" who lie on a large white cloud. One of them holds up a tablet with the hair oil products. The scene almost reminds the viewer of Da Vinci's Creazione di Adamo. A remarkable feature is the detailed elaboration of the women's clothes, costume accessories, jewellery and phenotypical features. The advertisement is aiming at the universal applicability of the hair oil's qualities, thus the text, "used by all nationalities (...)".
